704104f-a.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - Sheepshead Bay Road
704104f-a.text:
Emmons Avenue, east from Sheepshead Bay Road, show-
ing the W. P. A. widoning the avenue, as part of tho City's
now bolt parkway system which will gird the five boroughs.
Tho thoroughfare was widened about twenty feet, which necessi.
tatod the filling in of part of Sheopshead Bay, the razing
of old piers and boat houses, and ho construction of a new
bulkhead. Tho building--in Spanish architecture--seen on
the left in the four vies, 1s the Lundy Brothers Restaurant.
Viow 1: September 12, 1935
Viows 2,3: Septomber 26, 1935
View 4: Novomber 18, 1936
Works Progress Administration
F(ve Boroughs Project
CREDIT LINE IRPEiATIVE
704104f-a.folder: Emmons Avenue & Sheepshead Bay Road, Brooklyn, NY

704107f-a.text:
Emmons Ave., south side, opposite Sheepshead Bay Road. his eating
establishment known as ''Domenick's Hotel'' in 1924 and as Huismaig' Eotel in
1890 was demolished in 1934.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REP ODUCED.

704106f-b.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - Sheepshead Bay Road
704106f-b.text:
(1)
Emmons Ave., north side, between Sheepshead Bay Road and East 19th
Street. I the right background, is the New Lundy Restaurant, erected
in 1934.
August 1, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REE ODUCTIONS.  Negiwe t~E641
(2)
The same, showing only 1825-1827, at the N.W. corner of East 19th Street.
July 9, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
Bhowihd Nos. 1807-1819 at the N.E. corner of Sheepshead Bay Road.
The building with the conical roof once housed the only carousel, and
was the first ''movie'', in the Sheepshead Bay area.
July 9, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

704102f-d.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - Sheepshead Bay Road
704102f-d.text:
Emmons Avenue, east from Sheepshead Bay Road, show-
ing the piers, fishing boats and restaurants liring the
Sheepshead Bay waterfront. On the extreme right is Shore
BOulevard, at Manhattan Beach. Views 2, 3, ard 4 show
the new bulkhead, marked off by the line of spllee.
All the old frame structure and piers on the water's edge
will be razed and the avenue widened another twenty feet
by the W. P. A. Viee 4 is in a westerly directi c and
shows, in the background, the Bayview Apartments.
View 1: April 5, 134
View 2,3,4: June 27, 1934
Works Proress Administration
Five Boroughs Project
CREDIT LTE ITEATIVE
704102f-d.folder: Emmons Avenue & Sheepshead Bay Road, Brooklyn, NY

704105f-a.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - Sheepshead Bay Road
704105f-a.text:
Emmons Ave., south side, looking east from Sheepshead Bay Road.
These shacks once the pride of Sheepshead Bay, were condemned by the City
of New York, to make way for the new Emmons Ave., and Promenade.
July 8, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REE:ODUCTIONS.

704101f-b.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - Sheepshead Bay Road
704101f-b.text:
Emmons Avenue, west from near Sheepshead Bay Road,
showing the thoroughfare being widened and a new bulk-
head erected by the W. P. A. Many old piers and boat-
hhouses were razed and part of Sheepshead Bay filled in
when the avenue was widened, as part of the city's belt
highway system.
View 1: Fbbruary 28, 1936
View 2: June 17, 1936
Works Progress Administration
Five Bouroughs Project
;REDIT LINE IIPERATIVE
